content.description: The climb is on the left side of the overhanging cave in a large, undercling flake. This is one of Castlewood's top problems.
content.location:
This is located up the hillside up from the Inner-Canyon trail. To find this problem, go to the East Entrance of Castlewood (the one with the visitor center), and hike in on the Inner-Canyon trail for 10 minutes or so. Look for the powerlines that go across the canyon, as that is the general area of the problem. At that point along the trail, you come to a place where the pine-trees cover the trail (all other areas are mostly just scrub-oak trees), and there will be a prominent easy-boulder that can be climbed right on the trail with a flat face. Just to the right of that boulder is a small trail heading up the hillside. Follow this trail uphill for a short distance until you run into a cluster of boulders.

Tiger Woods is the first major boulder on the left with a perfect, overhanging face and the prominent sloper hold in the middle.

content.description: Start on a small edge with your right hand and an obvious little ledge for your feet. Move up to a mono and then up protruding cobbles and small crimps to an exciting topout! The landing is flat and grassy!
content.location: This problem is up on a second tier above Tim's Boulder and right of the Juggernaut climbs. Find the beautiful clean face just right of a short, obvious 5.4 corner.

content.description:
Start about 6' right of

Tiger Woods

on a painful undercling pocket. Move right past a small pocket/edge, then go up and left through a diagonal jug flake to an easy topout.
content.protection: Pads and possibly a spotter for the trees behind you.
content.location:
This is right of

Tiger Woods

, V7.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
